remixlab.proscene

Class InteractiveDrivableFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.proscene.Frame
      • remixlab.proscene.InteractiveFrame
        • remixlab.proscene.InteractiveDrivableFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabbable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InteractiveAvatarFrame, InteractiveCameraFrame

    public class InteractiveDrivableFrame
extends InteractiveFrame
    The InteractiveDrivableFrame represents an InteractiveFrame that can "fly" in the scene. It is the base class of all objects that are drivable in the Scene: InteractiveAvatarFrame and InteractiveCameraFrame.

    An InteractiveDrivableFrame basically moves forward, and turns according to the mouse motion. See flySpeed(), flyUpVector() and the Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InteractiveDrivableFrame

        public InteractiveDrivableFrame(Scene scn)
        Default constructor.

        flySpeed() is set to 0.0 and flyUpVector() is (0,1,0).

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public InteractiveDrivableFrame clone()
        Implementation of the clone method.

        Calls InteractiveFrame.clone() and makes a deep copy of the remaining object attributes.

        Overrides:
        clone in class InteractiveFrame
        See Also:
        InteractiveFrame.clone()

      • flySpeed

        public float flySpeed()
        Returns the fly speed, expressed in processing scene units.

        It corresponds to the incremental displacement that is periodically applied to the InteractiveDrivableFrame position when a Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD or Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD Scene.MouseAction is proceeded.

        Attention: When the InteractiveDrivableFrame is set as the Camera.frame() (which indeed is an instance of the InteractiveCameraFrame class) or when it is set as the Scene.avatar() (which indeed is an instance of the InteractiveAvatarFrame class), this value is set according to the Scene.radius() by Scene.setRadius(float).

      • setFlySpeed

        public void setFlySpeed(float speed)
        Sets the flySpeed(), defined in processing scene units.

        Default value is 0.0, but it is modified according to the Scene.radius() when the InteractiveDrivableFrame is set as the Camera.frame() (which indeed is an instance of the InteractiveCameraFrame class) or when the InteractiveDrivableFrame is set as the Scene.avatar() (which indeed is an instance of the InteractiveAvatarFrame class).

      • flyUpVector

        public processing.core.PVector flyUpVector()
        Returns the up vector used in fly mode, expressed in the world coordinate system.

        Fly mode corresponds to the Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD Scene.MouseAction bindings. In these modes, horizontal displacements of the mouse rotate the InteractiveDrivableFrame around this vector. Vertical displacements rotate always around the frame X axis.

        Default value is (0,1,0), but it is updated by the Camera when set as its Camera.frame(). Camera.setOrientation(Quaternion) and Camera.setUpVector(PVector) modify this value and should be used instead.

      • setFlyUpVector

        public void setFlyUpVector(processing.core.PVector up)
        Sets the flyUpVector(), defined in the world coordinate system.

        Default value is (0,1,0), but it is updated by the Camera when set as its Camera.frame(). Use Camera.setUpVector(PVector) instead in that case.

      • flyUpdate

        public void flyUpdate()
        Called for continuous frame motion in first person mode (see Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD).

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(Point eventPoint,
                Camera camera)
        Overloading of InteractiveFrame.mouseDragged(Point, Camera).

        Motion depends on mouse binding. The resulting displacements are basically the same of those of an InteractiveFrame, but moving forward and backward and turning actions are implemented.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface MouseGrabbable
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class InteractiveFrame
        See Also:
        Camera.screenWidth(), Camera.screenHeight(), Camera.fieldOfView()

      • mouseWheelMoved

        public void mouseWheelMoved(int rotation,
                   Camera camera)
        Overloading of InteractiveFrame.mouseWheelMoved(int, Camera).

        The wheel behavior depends on the wheel binded action. Current possible actions are Scene.MouseAction.ZOOM, Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD. Scene.MouseAction.ZOOM speed depends on #wheelSensitivity() the other two depend on #flySpeed().

        Specified by:
        mouseWheelMoved in interface MouseGrabbable
        Overrides:
        mouseWheelMoved in class InteractiveFrame
        See Also:
        InteractiveFrame.setWheelSensitivity(float)
